OptimalMotorPower.cpp

11 #include <calculator/motor/MotorCurrent.h>
12 #include <calculator/motor/Poles.h>
13 #include "calculator/motor/OptimalMotorPower.h"
14 #include "calculator/motor/MotorEfficiency.h"
15 #include "calculator/motor/MotorPowerFactor.h"
16 #include "calculator/motor/MotorPower.h"

18 
19 OptimalMotorPower::Output OptimalMotorPower::calculate() {
20  double tempLoadFraction = 0.00;
21  double mspkW;
22  double tempMsp = 0, tempMsp1 = 0, tempMsp2 = 0, powerE1 = 0, powerE2 = 0;
23  double eff1 = 0, eff2 = 0, lf = 0, current1 = 0, current2 = 0;
24 
25  double power, efficiency, current, powerFactor;
26 
27  while (true) {
28  MotorCurrent optimalMotorCurrent(motorRatedPower, motorRPM, lineFrequency, efficiencyClass,
29  specifiedEfficiency, tempLoadFraction, ratedVoltage);
30  current = optimalMotorCurrent.calculateOptimalCurrent();
31  //Adjustment to current based on measured Voltage
32  current = current * ((((fieldVoltage / ratedVoltage) - 1) * (1 + (-2 * tempLoadFraction))) + 1);
33  MotorEfficiency motorEfficiency(lineFrequency, motorRPM, efficiencyClass, motorRatedPower);
34  efficiency = motorEfficiency.calculate(tempLoadFraction, specifiedEfficiency);
35  //Similar to motorpowerfactor in existing case instead of ratedVoltage
36  MotorPowerFactor motorPowerFactor(lineFrequency, motorRPM, efficiencyClass, specifiedEfficiency,
37  motorRatedPower, tempLoadFraction, current, efficiency, fieldVoltage);
38  powerFactor = motorPowerFactor.calculate();
39 
40  power = MotorPower(fieldVoltage, current, powerFactor).calculate();
41  tempMsp = power * efficiency;
42  // Converting to KW for matching purpose.
43  mspkW = optimalMotorShaftPower * 0.746;
44 
45  if (tempMsp > mspkW || tempLoadFraction > 1.5) {
46  powerE2 = power;
47  eff2 = efficiency;
48  current2 = current;
49  tempMsp2 = tempMsp;
50  break;
51  } else {
52  powerE1 = power;
53  lf = tempLoadFraction;
54  eff1 = efficiency;
55  current1 = current;
56  tempMsp1 = tempMsp;
57  tempLoadFraction += 0.01;
58  }
59  }
60 
61  // Calculate Fractional Index
62  const double motorMspdiff = tempMsp2 - tempMsp1;
63  const double measuredMspdiff = mspkW - tempMsp1;
64  const double fractionalIndex = lf + ((measuredMspdiff / motorMspdiff) / 100);
65 
66  // Linear Interpolation of values
67  //double adjCurrent1 = (((fieldVoltage / ratedVoltage) - 1) * (1 - (2 * lf)) + 1) * current1;
68  //double adjCurrent2 = (((fieldVoltage / ratedVoltage) - 1) * (1 - (2 * lf2)) + 1) * current2;
69  //current = adjCurrent1 + 100 * (fractionalIndex - lf) * (adjCurrent2 - adjCurrent1);
70  // current = current1 + 100 * (fractionalIndex - lf) * (current2 - current1);
71  current = (current1 + 100 * (fractionalIndex - lf) * (current2 - current1)) * 460 / ratedVoltage;
72  efficiency = eff1 + 100 * (fractionalIndex - lf) * (eff2 - eff1);
73  power = powerE1 + 100 * (fractionalIndex - lf) * (powerE2 - powerE1);
74  powerFactor = power / (current * fieldVoltage * std::sqrt(3) / 1000);
75 
76  return {power, efficiency, current, powerFactor, fractionalIndex};
77 }
